We recently wrote to @EnvAgency to request an update on work to tackle pollution in the river https://t.co/JMMo4ca5Cn

@nicolas32140480 @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @RedIndustries2 There‚Äôs no gas here right now so I‚Äôm down to using my inhaler every hour now to combat the after effects, rather than constantly, which is nice!
Now wondering why they‚Äôre dumping in cell 3 and stuff not from their own sites though!

@RedIndustries2 choose to take normal waste rather than inert materials in disdain for the suffering of the community & a message of ‚Äòwe are untouchable‚Äô to the @EnvAgency Find your backbone @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA https://t.co/VhqevBdxxy
@SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe Stinks tonight
@hackneycouncil @SaveLeaMarshes @EnvAgency Thank you for flagging the risks here, but what needs to happen is sign postings warning people before they take a dip!

#GoodFriday #Fish fantastic video of #BrookLamprey spawning
Filmed by #Herefordshire farmer Tony Norman a leading ambassador for the protection and improvement of our rivers in the #Wye catchment. 
#SpawningWatch 
@WUFoundation @theriverstrust @RiverFishUk @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/0jtpX2nKyd

We went down to the Aldersbrook today to check that the sewage discharges had fully stopped and to assess the damage to the brook and the River Roding. Absolutely shocked and saddened to discover that the discharges are still happening *9 days* after we first reported them. https://t.co/pvKK1VglKQ

We will not be silenced until our children are protected. The government authorities are not resolving this @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland . @BorisJohnson you need to step in @StinkStopthe https://t.co/0vYyfqHaEW

tweets.text:
#BiodiversityLoss has emerged as key risk to the ways in which we do pretty much everything.

-@WWFCanada
- Coastal First Nations Great Bear Initiative (@CFNGBI)
- The @WorldBank and 
- @EcoAdvisors 

https://t.co/W1wgSgaFtT

There was more pollution flowing into Shutterton Brook yesterday and it‚Äôs still not recovered from the last pollution events. That all flows into a wildlife refuge of SSSI Exe Estuary ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è@EnvAgencySW
@JoKingDevon @BrentGoose Very Jo, I know nature will overcome and it will all repair in time ...but it‚Äôs all so needless

Works have started on the 1st step of Phase 2 of the #Earby Flood Alleviation Scheme. The works will reduce flood risk from Victoria Clough with the construction of a flood embankment, which will store flood water upstream of Earby. Work is expected to finish by mid-April. #FCERM https://t.co/LcFKvCif2z

urls.title: The Environment Agency Proposes Revocation of Licences
urls.description: The Environment Agency published a consultation on the revocation of eight abstraction licences throughout the UK. Driven by a new programme for sustainable abstraction, appropriate use of water resources and their conservation, the regulator set out the details of their proposal.

tweets.text: @RossCherrington @SoilsAlliance @EnvAgencySW Yes, accept this is the typical veg scenario, but are you thinking this is not typical or widespread soil problem?

üëáWaste dumping returning to Walleys Quarry Landfill for a limited period from tomorrow for the reason given by the operator RED / late notification/ no comment from @EnvAgencyMids / stink continues / zero respect for the community by the operator and regulator üñï@StinkStopthe https://t.co/qcolbiYtkk

@joannaofottawa @SaveLeaMarshes @bergdenken Remember boaters have to live on an open sewer. When a propeller becomes jammed with rubbish often only solution is to get in the water. My partner had to submerge in it four times last summer and got sick each time @CRTSouthEast @thameswater @EnvAgencySE
@StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA As @EnvAgencyMids are their usual silent https://t.co/Eh6rpmc1nz

@bergdenken I was commissioned to write a photo essay about the Lea River (it‚Äôs appearing soon) and what I found researching it is pretty awful. This article feels highly irresponsible in the light of how much sewage and how many chemicals are in this river.

@friendsofmeath1 Absolutely! Local campaigns like @LDNWaterkeeper and @SaveLeaMarshes have been working hard on this. @hackneycouncil has just written to @CanalRiverTrust and @EnvAgency calling for action

urls.title: Preventing plastic pollution business workshop
urls.description: Free preventing plastic pollution virtual workshop for your business, with insights, tips, case studies and round table discussions.

tweets.text:
Are you a business that produces or uses plastics? Or a business that has plastics within your supply chain?

A free preventing #plasticpollution virtual workshop is available for your business on 19 April.

Find out more: https://t.co/5E3wvdJrWY @EnvAgencySE @GreentechSouth https://t.co/r5DamaBn7J
